title-group.article-title: Paramyxovirus Infection in a Moluccan Cockatoo (Cacatua moluccensis) with Neurologic Signs

abstract.p: A paramyxovirus was identified ultrastructurally in the brain of a Moluccan Cockatoo (Cacatua moluccensis) which had clinical signs of incoordination and proprioceptive deficits progressing rapidly to recumbency accompanied by twitching. Remarkable microscopic changes localized in the rostral cerebrum consisted of large numbers of intracytoplasmic and occasional intranuclear inclusion bodies, neuronal necrosis, syncytial cell formation, and a relative lack of inflammation associated with the infection. Based on the current classification system and knowledge about avian paramyxoviruses, a group 3 paramyxovirus was suspected to be the causative agent of the neurologic signs and microscopic lesions.
